channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Step free access at bus stop no longer, 2nd December
item.description:
This bus stop was replaced earlier this year, Why? Since then busses seem to have difficulty getting close to the kerb due to position of new stop. making it difficult if you have mobility issues. Also brand new bus timetable was removed and had never been replaced. Please sort this out.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springbank Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Drains completely blocked, 1st December
item.description:
Heading north from Prestbury, after crossing the brook, all the drain covers are badly blocked all the way up the the layby just passed the Ellenborough Park hotel entrance. The gutter and road side is full of dirt and badly needs sweeping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4632, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing sign, 1st December
item.description:
The sign warning drivers of Deer in the area is missing from the sign post .There is thew horse sign but Deer is missing .Can you please replace it
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The jutting out pedestrian crossing kerb not seen in dark, 1st December
item.description:
The pedestrian crossing curb near the Ivy Restaurant, which juts out into the road cannot be seen in the dark. It is not painted and the street lighting is very poor. I have just burst a tyre on it and have to take the car to Kwik Fit tomorrow to get a new one.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16-17, Montpellier Walk, Montpellier, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pothole - re-opened, 1st December
item.description:
Pothole - re-opened. A horrible pothole by the garage that was repaired has been washed away and has now opened up again. Right in the line of tyres and will damage vehicles. Needs fixing asap. Why don't the contractors fix them properly?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bouncers Lane, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: Standing water, 1st December
item.description:
The road has standing water from the flooding last sunday 24th, half way across the road by bridge farm on the old Gloucester road
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Old Gloucester Road, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Manhole covering storm drain is leaking and, after rain, lifts from a secure position., 1st December
item.description:
The manhole is located at the junction of Haymes Road and Haymes Drive. What3Words identifier is "incurring.left.adapt". Water is flowing down Haymes Drive, through the gardens of 2 residents and emerging in front of the house Tall Trees whose garage has been flooded. When the temperature drops towards zero black ice forms around the leak and downstream presenting a hazard to vehicles turning off the B4632. Also, there is no footpath on Haymes Drive and pedestrians have to navigate the water/ice to reach properties on Haymes Drive or to leave to access B4632. The manhole has leaked for more than a week. It was originally reported to Severn Trent who now advise that it is a County Council issue/responsibility.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Haymes Drive, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: Another sink hole is developing outside 30 Malleson Rod., 1st December
item.description:
This is what the one outside 40 Malleson Road looked like just before it sunk. The surface is flexing if you stand on it. This sinkhole is in the carriageway and could fail at any time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 37, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A sinkhole occurred in March 2024 and is still not repaired., 1st December
item.description:
The barriers put in place outside 40 Malleson Road have been hit by a vehicle again today. The clips are now completely damaged. The sinkhole has been here for 9 months with no action taken. This is a safety issue as it is unlit and completely blocking the eastbound carriageway. It is causing extreme inconvenience for the residents at 38 and 40 Malleson Road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48,50, Malleson Road, Gotherington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
